I used to play Counter-Strike from the CD I bought. At that time, I haven't discovered internet. And no bots. So I ended up playing alone, doing literally nothing.

Sometimes, I explored the map a bit and wondered what's beyond the fences and locked gates designed to keep players in the map. I also wondered how would people go in and out. Back then. I haven't discovered noclip, but I discovered free look. So I looked beyond them. What's out there? Nothing. Yep, nothing.

Later, I bought Counter-Strike: Condition Zero. That game goes to another review [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198141201307/recommended/80]here[/url].

10 years later, I discovered the internet. Needless to say, I didn't enjoy being killed by players.

Thank you, Valve. 0/10
The best game of my childhood)
Um cl√°ssico fps online que todos deveriam ter a experiencia de jogar. 10/10

Almost 20 years passed since legendary Counter Strike 1.6 was released. Still a good game with stable playerbase. Despite its age it's still fun to play it. Howewer, I can only recommend it if you find yourself in one of the following situations:

- you want to play CS on an old computer
- you want to complete you CS collection
- you dislike Source and Global Offensive
- nostalgia
- you want to play with friends who play 1.6

Why? It's old, of course. It's really old, looks bad, audio is horrible... and everything is as bad as you would expect from a 20 years old game. But it's the old Counter Strike and the gameplay is still as great as 20 years ago. If you're a new CS player I don't think you would find this game interesting, get Global Offensive instead - it's the better and actively supported game. But if you have any reason why you want this game specifically, buy it because if this is what you're looking for you won't be disappointed.

And of course, the game runs great on Linux natively with fully native OpenGL support. Frames per second are locked at 100 (not Linux specific) but it's very easy to override this value in the in-game console:
[code]
developer 1
fps_override 1
fps_max 1000[/code]

1000 FPS (or any value you want) easily, useful on 144Hz and 240Hz monitors. I didn't encounter any issues with running this game from 1999 on a Linux distribution from 2018.
